items.title: Getting TypeError: _wrap_socket() argument 'sock' must be _socket.socket, not SSLSocket
items.body:
Hello SignalFx Python,

I am getting the below error traceback when trying to call [`_BaseSignalFxIngestClient.send`](https://github.com/signalfx/signalfx-python/blob/master/signalfx/ingest.py#L124):

- I am exposed to the below traceback via the SignalFx [`_logger`](https://github.com/signalfx/signalfx-python/blob/master/signalfx/__init__.py#L55) with `WARNING` verbosity.
- Data points are not being ingested any more per the SignalFx UI, confirming the post is failing

```
2020-07-27 16:00:09,408:ERROR:signalfx.ingest:Posting data to SignalFx failed.
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "C:\path\to\venv\lib\site-packages\signalfx\ingest.py", line 245, in _send
    self._post(self._batch_data(datapoints_list),
  File "C:\path\to\venv\lib\site-packages\signalfx\ingest.py", line 275, in _post
    response = session.post(url, data=data, timeout=timeout)
  File "C:\path\to\venv\lib\site-packages\requests\sessions.py", line 578, in post
    return self.request('POST', url, data=data, json=json, **kwargs)
  File "C:\path\to\venv\lib\site-packages\requests\sessions.py", line 530, in request
    resp = self.send(prep, **send_kwargs)
  File "C:\path\to\venv\lib\site-packages\requests\sessions.py", line 643, in send
    r = adapter.send(request, **kwargs)
  File "C:\path\to\venv\lib\site-packages\requests\adapters.py", line 439, in send
    resp = conn.urlopen(
  File "C:\path\to\venv\lib\site-packages\urllib3\connectionpool.py", line 670, in urlopen
    httplib_response = self._make_request(
  File "C:\path\to\venv\lib\site-packages\urllib3\connectionpool.py", line 381, in _make_request
    self._validate_conn(conn)
  File "C:\path\to\venv\lib\site-packages\urllib3\connectionpool.py", line 978, in _validate_conn
    conn.connect()
  File "C:\path\to\venv\lib\site-packages\urllib3\connection.py", line 362, in connect
    self.sock = ssl_wrap_socket(
  File "C:\path\to\venv\lib\site-packages\urllib3\util\ssl_.py", line 384, in ssl_wrap_socket
    return context.wrap_socket(sock, server_hostname=server_hostname)
  File "C:\Python38\lib\ssl.py", line 500, in wrap_socket
    return self.sslsocket_class._create(
  File "C:\Python38\lib\ssl.py", line 1031, in _create
    self._sslobj = self._context._wrap_socket(
TypeError: _wrap_socket() argument 'sock' must be _socket.socket, not SSLSocket
```

This started popping up when I bumped SignalFx from version 1.1.6 to 1.1.9.  When I reinstall 1.1.6, I continue to get this error.  It seems that temporarily, I'm stuck with this error.

Is this a SignalFx problem, or a problem with `requests` or `urllib3`?  If it's a SignalFx problem, what might I be doing wrong?

---

**Versions**

- OS: Windows 10
- Python: 3.8.2 and 3.8.5
- OpenSSL-Win64: 1.1.1g

Here are a few of my pip installed packages that seem relevant (all newest versions as of July 27th 2020):

```
requests==2.24.0
signalfx==1.1.9
urllib3==1.25.10
eventlet==0.25.2
```

items.title: falling back to JSON fails
items.body:
using the client v1.1.5 getting this error :

```
Protocol Buffers not installed properly; falling back to JSON.
Posting data to SignalFx failed.
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/signalfx/ingest.py", line 244, in _send
    self._INGEST_ENDPOINT_DATAPOINT_SUFFIX))
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/signalfx/ingest.py", line 266, in _post
    data = c.compress(data) + c.flush()
TypeError: a bytes-like object is required, not 'str' 
```
could repro by running `pip uninstall protobuf` and sending an otherwise good metric payload.

items.title: signalFx.SignalFlowClient.execute() never returns
Travis CI builds are missing SignalFx token
SignalFx client not reporting failure when token has exceeded quota
items.body:
I have been streaming data to SignalFx using `client = SignalFx().ingest('some_token')`.

Unbeknownst to me, the token exceeded its quota, and new metrics were not being uploaded.  When using `client.send()` and then viewing `response.ok` ([source](https://github.com/signalfx/signalfx-python/blob/master/signalfx/ingest.py#L251)), it was `True`, even though the data was not entering SignalFx.  In my eyes, this is a silent failure.

I ultimately figured out the root cause of the token having hit its quota.  Is there some way to have the SignalFx client report that the given token is at its quota's limit?

items.title: '-' instead of value in the data table
items.body:
Hello, 
I am using SignalFx to monitor an AUC metric per group_id, I use the following code: 

```python
with signalfx.SignalFx().ingest(config['API_token']) as sfx:
           sfx.send(
                     gauges=[
                            {
                                'metric': 'AUC',
                                'value': avgAuc,
                                'timestamp': time.time(),
                                'dimensions': {'group_id': group_id}
                            }
                        ])
```

where avgAuc is float.

But I've got '-' instead of values in the data table. I have data in avgAuc before sending. Could you, please, suggest, where can be an error?

items.title: HTTP request hits ReadTimeout when posting data
items.body:
We capture exceptions using Sentry and we regularly see read timeout exceptions from the signalfx library.

```
HTTPSConnectionPool(host='ingest.signalfx.com', port=443): Read timed out. (read timeout=1)
```

Looks like this happens when the ingest endpoint is unable to respond within a second.

Does this mean the data point was dropped? Is there a way to increase this value or even allow this value to be customized?

A longer timeout means connections stay open longer waiting for a response, could this cause issues with potentially piling up connections or thread on the client side? Haven't dug into the code yet, wondering what the potential downside to bumping this up to say 3 seconds is.

Here is the exception and stack trace (most recent call first):

```
ReadTimeout: HTTPSConnectionPool(host='ingest.signalfx.com', port=443): Read timed out. (read timeout=1)
  File "signalfx/ingest.py", line 207, in _send
    self._INGEST_ENDPOINT_DATAPOINT_SUFFIX))
  File "signalfx/ingest.py", line 223, in _post
    response = session.post(url, data=data, timeout=timeout)
  File "requests/sessions.py", line 511, in post
    return self.request('POST', url, data=data, json=json, **kwargs)
  File "requests/sessions.py", line 468, in request
    resp = self.send(prep, **send_kwargs)
  File "raven/breadcrumbs.py", line 326, in send
    resp = real_send(self, request, *args, **kwargs)
  File "requests/sessions.py", line 576, in send
    r = adapter.send(request, **kwargs)
  File "requests/adapters.py", line 449, in send
    raise ReadTimeout(e, request=request)
```


Thread name: 'SignalFxDatapointSendThread'

Most recent error we saw was on *Jun 3, 2018* at *2:20:20 AM EDT* and I said this is a periodic occurrence we keep running into. Does not appear to have a pattern from what we can tell.

items.title: Get data to pandas dataframe
items.body:
This is a nice-to-have.

Would be great if there was a way out of the box to get historical data via signalflow straight into pandas dataframe, which is kind of a standard data type for serious data analysis.

I put together a small proof of concept at https://github.com/somic/signalflow_to_pandas_dataframe

A minor challenge is signalfx-python does not require pandas currently, it's pulled as a requirement for signalflow-cli so I am not sure what's the best way to make it happen from overall maintainer's perspective.

But would be very cool.

items.title: python3.6 support
items.body: Hi, could you help add python3.6 support? Thanks!

items.title: How to pull data points with signalflow in a (semi) non-blocking manner?
items.body:
[The example code of executing a signalflow computation](https://github.com/signalfx/signalfx-python#executing-signalflow-computations) illustrates a way to retrieve data points where the data pulling is blocked at "computation.stream()" if non is reaady, quote

```python
program = "data('cpu.utilization').mean().publish()"
with signalfx.SignalFx().signalflow('MY_TOKEN') as flow:
    computation = flow.execute(program)
    for msg in computation.stream():  # <-- blocked here
        ...
```

Is there a way to "peek" at the stream to learn if there's data there, e.g., "computation.has_msg()"? Or make "computation.stream()" return if no msg is ready, instead of busy waiting in the inside while-loop?

items.title: Signalfx client not working from Multiprocessing
items.body:
Looks like when running signalfx client within a forked process using the 'multiprocessing' module, it fails to send any data.

https://gist.github.com/anonymous/9194c5b8619296fe39544f3405ce939c

items.title: explain best practices for use in gevent (or other such) environments
items.body: Without reading the code it's hard to tell if this is gevent-safe and if signalfx.SignalFx().ingest() should be instantiated once and then sfx.send() safely used from greenlets.  Thanks.

items.title: Python 3: AttributeError: 'dict' object has no attribute 'iteritems'
items.body:
I am testing the current master branch (upcoming release 1.0.6) which I installed with

`pip install git+https://github.com/signalfx/signalfx-python`

and when sending a data point with the ingest API, I get the error:

```
[previous stack frames come from my application...]
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.4/dist-packages/signalfx/ingest.py", line 121, in send
    for metric_type, datapoints in data.iteritems():
AttributeError: 'dict' object has no attribute 'iteritems'
```

Python version is 3.4 inside Ubuntu 14.04, installed using the package manager.

items.title: Python 3: NameError: name 'unicode' is not defined
items.body:
I saw that #29 was merged and 1.0.5 was released, so I tested it inside Docker (image python:latest) by running

```
pip3 install signalfx
```

Now I get the following error:

```
root@682c4a5e1844:/# python
Python 3.5.2 (default, Sep 24 2016, 05:23:05) 
[GCC 4.9.2] on linux
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> import signalfx
>>> signalfx.SignalFx().ingest("asdf")
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/site-packages/signalfx/__init__.py", line 98, in ingest
    from . import ingest
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/site-packages/signalfx/ingest.py", line 16, in <module>

  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/site-packages/signalfx/generated_protocol_buffers/signal_fx_protocol_buffers_pb2.py", line 111, in <module>
    has_default_value=False, default_value=unicode("", "utf-8"),
NameError: name 'unicode' is not defined
```

items.title: Python 3: ImportError: No module named 'constants'
items.body:
On a host running Ubuntu 14.04 (Python 3.4) I installed signalfx using
`pip3 install signalfx`

However when trying to use it, i get an ImportError.

```
$ python3
Python 3.4.3 (default, Sep 14 2016, 12:36:27) 
[GCC 4.8.4] on linux
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> import signalfx
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.4/dist-packages/signalfx/__init__.py", line 45, in <module>
    from constants import DEFAULT_API_ENDPOINT, DEFAULT_INGEST_ENDPOINT, \
ImportError: No module named 'constants'
```

The same happens inside a Docker container when performing the following steps

```
$ docker pull python
[...]
$ docker run -it python bash
root@964bb9e12c78:/# pip3 install signalfx
[...]
root@964bb9e12c78:/# python
Python 3.5.2 (default, Sep 24 2016, 05:23:05) 
[GCC 4.9.2] on linux
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> import signalfx
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/site-packages/signalfx/__init__.py", line 45, in <module>
    from constants import DEFAULT_API_ENDPOINT, DEFAULT_INGEST_ENDPOINT, \
ImportError: No module named 'constants'

```

items.title: Detect authentication failure
items.body:
Hello,

The following snippet doesn't raise any error while the token is invalid:

``` python
import signalfx
sfx = signalfx.SignalFx().ingest('fake')
sfx.send(gauges=[{'metric': 'fake-metric', 'value' :  1, 'dimensions': {'host':'127.0.0.1'}}])
sfx.stop()
```

I suspect the thread actually sending the metric fails. However, I couldn't find a way with the current library API to retrieve this error.

items.title: Release the next version of this to PyPi?
items.body:
I see that version 0.3.7 was released on November 12th, 2015 going by git tags, so it's been quite a while since you've release a new version of this.

I'm looking to use the `update_dimension` method which is present on the SignalFxClient class on the master branch, but did not exist at the time of the 0.3.7 tag.

If you're not planning on doing a release soon, I can just call the private `_put` method on the SignalFxClient directly for now, so it's not a showstopper, but it would be nice if you'd release the next version soon.

Thanks,
Paul

items.title: SSL Error when connecting with the python client.
items.body:
When attempting to connect to signalfx with the provided python client, the following SSL error occurs:\

SSLError: hostname 'api.signalfx.com' doesn't match either of '*.signalfuse.com', 'signalfuse.com'

Here's the full log:

INFO:urllib3.connectionpool:Starting new HTTPS connection (4): api.signalfx.com
ERROR:root:Posting to SignalFx failed.
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File ".../signalfx/**init**.py", line 188, in _post
    response = _session.post(url, data=data, timeout=self._timeout)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/requests/sessions.py", line 497, in post
    return self.request('POST', url, data=data, *_kwargs)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/requests/sessions.py", line 455, in request
    resp = self.send(prep, *_send_kwargs)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/requests/sessions.py", line 558, in send
    r = adapter.send(request, *_kwargs)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/requests/adapters.py", line 385, in send
    raise SSLError(e)
SSLError: hostname 'api.signalfx.com' doesn't match either of '_.signalfuse.com', 'signalfuse.com'
